Gui

Class CardinalGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Gui.CardinalGui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultiplayerGui, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class CardinalGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements MultiplayerGui
    This class represents the Graphical User Interface reffering to the Cardinal Domino Type Of Game. It's a JFrame made with code and design that implements the class MultiplayerGui.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardinalGui

        public CardinalGui()
        Class Constructor. Does all the generated code made in Design by us and some changes for internationalization reasons, initializes the variables used and adjusts the design to be better-looking(adding layouts,gaps,colors..).

        Specified by:
        readFromHand in interface MultiplayerGui
        Returns:
        the number-"name" of Button representing the Tile chosen from the hand of Player.(-1 represents that noone of the Buttons where pressed)

      • giveChoice

        public int giveChoice()
        Shows a message to the Player-Bot giving them the choice to choose where to put the chosen tile that fits both on beggining and in the end.
        Returns:
        1 for "YES",2 for "NO

        public boolean askForReverse()

        Returns:

      • wantToDraw

        public int wantToDraw()
        Represents if Player playing this game want to draw a Tile.
        Returns:
        1 if wants to draw Tile,0 if pressed a button to put a Tile, otherwise -1.
